alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 8:07PM CST until February 14 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Franklin, Morris and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CST Sunday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 02/26/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 815 PM CST.
